from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from matplotlib import pyplot

#spark.conf.set('spark.sql.parquet.int96RebaseModeInRead', 'CORRECTED') # TimeStamp Issues
df = spark.read.load(lakepath + "parquet/orders*.parquet", format="parquet")
dfproducts = spark.read.load(lakepath + "parquet/products*.parquet", format="parquet")

df = df.select("Quantity", "TotalPrice", "ProductId")
df = df.join(dfproducts, df.ProductId == dfproducts.Id)
df = df.select("TotalPrice", concat(df.BrandName, lit(" "), df.Name).alias("Product")) \
    .groupBy("Product").agg(sum("TotalPrice").alias("Total"))
df = df.orderBy(col("Total").desc())

# First create a pandas frame
df = df.limit(10).toPandas()

# Clear plot area
pyplot.clf()

fig = pyplot.figure(figsize=(12,8))
pyplot.title("Total sales by product")
pyplot.ylabel("Products")
pyplot.xlabel("Sales in $")
pyplot.barh(y=df.Product, width=df.Total, color="green")



pyplot.xticks(rotation=70)

pyplot.show()

from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from matplotlib import pyplot

spark.conf.set('spark.sql.parquet.int96RebaseModeInRead', 'CORRECTED') # TimeStamp Issues
df = spark.read.load(lakepath + "parquet/orders*.parquet", format="parquet")
dfproducts = spark.read.load(lakepath + "parquet/products*.parquet", format="parquet")

df = df.select("Quantity", "TotalPrice", "ProductId")
df = df.join(dfproducts, df.ProductId == dfproducts.Id)

df1 = df.select("TotalPrice", col("BrandName").alias("Brand")) \
    .groupBy("Brand").agg(sum("TotalPrice").alias("Total"))
df1 = df1.orderBy(col("Total").desc())


df2 = df.select("Quantity", col("BrandName").alias("Brand")) \
    .groupBy("Brand").agg(sum("Quantity").alias("Quantity"))
df2 = df2.orderBy(col("Quantity").desc())

# First create a pandas frame
df1 = df1.limit(10).toPandas()
df2 = df2.limit(10).toPandas()


# Clear plot area
pyplot.clf()

fig, figs = pyplot.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(10,4))
pyplot.title("Sales Insights")
figs[0].barh(y=df1.Brand, width=df1.Total, color="red")
figs[0].set_title("Total sales by brand")

figs[1].pie(df2.Quantity, labels=df2.Brand, autopct="%1d")
figs[1].set_title("Amounts by Brand")


pyplot.show()
